greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p when e == 2, otherwise a(p^e) = 1.
comment: Product of those distinct prime factors that occur exactly twice in the prime factorization of n, that is, whose exponent is 2.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p when e == 2, otherwise a(p^e) = 1.
xref: Row 3 of array A106177, and the square roots of its row 9.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 16 2019
